intro: Alsine saginoides, commonly known as narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, particularly in North America. Alsine saginoides is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
